Ogilvy is a WPP company (NYSE: WPP). For more information, visit Ogilvy.com, and follow us on LinkedIn, X, Instagram, and Facebook.


Ogilvy UK has been creating iconic ideas that deliver impact at scale for clients ever since David Ogilvy founded the company in 1948. Ogilvy UK specialises in bringing together brand advertising, customer experience marketing, PR, influence and consulting, all fuelled by Behavioural Science. Our world-class award-winning creative campaigns deliver solutions for clients including Sainsburys, Argos, , Mondelz International, Unilever, TK Maxx and Pernod Ricard.  
In 2023, Ogilvy UK celebrated their 75th anniversary and was the most awarded agency in Europe. Ogilvy is home to the largest influencer marketing practice globally, and hosts the worlds biggest festival of behavioural science and creativity, Nudgestock  now in its 12th year. 
Are you the kind of strategist that wants to create enormous impact on some of the biggest, and most famous brands in the world?
Do you want to build your career in an agency that has been named Network of the Year for both creativity and effectiveness? 
Do you look out and above your discipline, and resist the desire to stay in your lane?
Are you a well all-rounded strategist with strong knowledge of how brands grow in the Social & Digital Age that you use to drive transformative work?
If so, read on.
A bit about Ogilvy. 
Youve heard of us, and you know some our famous campaigns. But do you know how we work, and what makes us different?
Most importantly, we dont just create advertising ideas, we create ideas that impact how consumers see and navigate through their world. We achieve this by breaking down the barriers and working fluidly between the engines of modern marketing today: Advertising, Consulting, Experience, PR & Social & Influence, and Health.
We call this Borderless Creativity.  Ogilvy scales this by seamlessly connecting and accessing the deep and diverse cultural expertise of 132 offices in 83 countries and in a way that celebrates our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. 
About This RoleThis is a role across some of the most iconic brands around within The Coca-Cola Company from trademark Coca-Cola to Sprite and Fanta. The role sits at the centre of a bespoke model, WPP Open X, created to deliver impact for the needs of these brands.Youll be employed and homed at Ogilvy, sitting in the heart of a welcoming, feisty and fun planning community in Londons Sea Containers House  a key WPP campus where you will work closely and collaborate with wider WPP teams from David, VML, Wavemaker and EssenceMediacom across continents.What the role entails

Drive strategic planning from client brief to creative delivery across Global, Regional and GB campaigns
Lead the necessary research to identify core driving insights for your creative briefs that will lead to increasingly ground-breaking work
Unlock opportunities within key audience passion points, such as music, food culture, gaming with in-depth focus on culture and experiential.
Bring to life storytelling under newly articulated brand platforms through localisation and activation across the end-to-end ecosystem
Integrate strategy and execution of work across Advertising, Brand, Content (ABC), PR&I and social, and Consumer Experiences to deliver single narrative connected concepts

In Terms Of The Skills We Are Looking For

Very strong strategic thinker who enjoys grappling with brand foundations and can capture the essence of brands in simple, persuasive language.
Confident discussing business issues and understand how brands grow in CPG, prior experience would be advantageous
Data literacy and ability to understand clients business results and issues with experience writing effectiveness case studies
Ability to think quickly on your feet, engaging in strategy conversations with clarity and confidence with clients
A passion for writing creative briefs that lead to amazing work
Ability to inspire through well designed presentations, skilled verbal articulation and visual communication
A keen interest in the creative process, demonstrating a readiness to help shape/champion creative ideas, while making sure they are on strategy
Expertise in modern marketing with an understanding of how brands must show up in todays ecosystem
A worldly view embodied in a curiosity about other markets and cultures, experience working on global or pan-market brands would be a strong advantage
Strong initiative to push work and deliver strong both as a team player and collaborator as well as working alone with autonomy: owning workstreams from start to finish; planning the approach; managing your time effectively and demonstrating attention to detail.

 
What can you expect from us? This is a role where you can make career defining work, working alongside agency talent and clients who are at the very top of their game. Beyond career development, Ogilvy offers a great fun and fulfilling working environment, with a strong community and a lack of silos. Youll be part of a tight-knit team of people willing to go out of their way for each other and youll get guidance and full support from senior leadership team members.Our learning and development team are on hand to provide training for you, to help you excel in every aspect of your role. So, if you think you may not have experience in some aspects of this position, dont worry, and apply away. Were here to help you grow and nurture your skills.How we help you thrive

25 days annual leave + 1 Volunteer Day
Bupa Healthcare (includes Bupa health assessment and menopause support)
Enhanced Maternity, Adoption and Shared Parental leave
Hybrid Working model
A 1.5:1 matching pension structure
Wellbeing and Health: Up to 25. per month towards physical or online exercise class membership, Unmind membership, LifeWorks tool and annual eye tests. 
Learning and development budgets plus Enhanced and ongoing wellbeing incentives and activities throughout the year
Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme 
Life Assurance x4 salary 
Inclusion@Ogilvy: To foster an inclusive environment we have our internal groups: Ogilvy Rewired, Roots, Equals, Proud plus Parents and Carers. See here for more information

About Ogilvy:   
Ogilvy UK has been creating iconic ideas that deliver impact at scale for clients ever since David Ogilvy founded the company in 1948. We are the most awarded agency in Europe and we specialise in bringing together brand advertising, customer experience marketing, PR, influence and consulting, all fuelled by Behavioural Science. Our world-class award-winning creative campaigns deliver solutions for clients including Molson Coors, Mondelz International, Unilever, and many more.  Ogilvy is reimagining how brands are built in the age of social, and has built a team of social experts who embrace the chaos of social, using it as the business engine behind the brand and creating earned-first impact through creativity. 
The Role:  
This is an exciting opportunity at Ogilvy to play a key role in elevating our social capabilities for 2025, helping us redefine our social and content offer and realize our new global ambition of building social brands. Ogilvy is seeking an experienced Senior Strategist who will sit within our Social Strategy team. They will be responsible for collaborating closely with clients to gain a deep understanding of their businesses, target audiences, and brand values and developing bold creative strategies that answer their unique challenges. Youll take full ownership of key workstreams and use your deep social knowledge to develop innovation strategic solutions. Youll also benefit from being part of Ogilvys wider strategy community where youll work alongside - and learn from - specialised strategists in PR, influence, brand and experience, as well as experts in behavioural science and consulting.  
As a mentor and a leader, youll help guide and support junior team members in their professional growth and strategic development, because you know what great social strategy looks like. Youll advocate for diversity of thought and champion inclusive approaches from the team, because you know that strategy can come in lots of different flavours and a great insight can be found anywhere.   
  
Key Responsibilities: 

Strategic development and execution: Lead the development of social and content strategies, playbooks, workshops, and measurement frameworks for clients (with guidance from the team lead on bigger projects). Adapt the strategic output based on client need (e.g. tissue decks, strategic responses, paths forward, workshops, etc). Define the brands role of social and create messaging frameworks with clear content pillars, all laddering back to the overall brand vision and supported by social intelligence data. Build trust and rapport with clients and colleagues and sell them on your strong strategic thinking. 


Creative briefing: Develop strategic creative territories and write clear briefs for the creative team to explore them. Articulate social-first creative ideas to clients and help them understand how/ why they work. 


Insight mining and creative problem solving:. Intuitively understand client challenges and leverage business data to get to the core of the problem. Uncover unexpected insights from a diverse range of sources to help shape your social communication strategies. Interpret reporting data to suggest improvements to campaign or organic social performance.  


Impactful storyteller and engaging presenter: Inspire internal and external stakeholders on the strategic opportunities of social and present narratives in compelling and memorable ways. Design and lead workshops/ client presentations and act as an ideas catalyst and strategic partner for clients, asking insightful questions to get clients thinking differently about their brand on social.  


Leading and mentoring junior team members:. Provide mentorship and guidance to junior team members, fostering their growth and leading by example. Contribute to Ogilvy's culture of excellence, innovation, and impactful creativity. Know what a great social strategy looks like and help upskill team members on that thinking.  


Thinking social first, not social only: Possess a deep understanding of social best practises, trends, tools and technologies and apply this knowledge to clients to enhance their campaign performance. Share industry insights and best practices to inspire internal teams and clients. Understand and articulate how social works within the larger media ecosystem and within the clients broader campaign/ business goals.  


Collaborating cross functionally: Think laterally about how to uncover unique insights by working closely with our in-house Marketing Science partners to test hypotheses and get to the right answers. Ensure alignment of campaigns with brand strategies by collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams. Contribute to new business pitches and proposals, infusing industry insights and creative ideas. 

  
Requirements:  

Experience designing tailored strategic social plans that address diverse business goals, incorporating latest social trends and best practises.  
Relentlessly curious about social, with a deep knowledge of social trends, platforms and aesthetics. A proactive approach to staying updated with industry trends, tools, and technologies. 
Experience defining the role of social for brands and creating messaging frameworks for brands with clear content territories/ pillars.  
Experience in creative agencies or equivalent environments. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects and priorities efficiently. 
Demonstrated ability to provide mentorship and guidance to junior team members. Commitment to fostering inclusivity and embracing innovative approaches to strategy development. 
Effective presentation skills to convey ideas and strategies convincingly. Ability to lead presentations/ workshops confidently. 
Ability to collaborate effectively with XFN teams and with colleagues from diverse disciplines and backgrounds.
